title: Intellectual Property Law Explained by Adv. Ameet Datta | ANI vs Mohak Mangal, Copyright law | EP_06
description:
#ANIControversy #mohakmangal 

In this episode, we discuss Intellectual property law with Ameet Datta. With an experience in IP Law spanning over 27 years, he breaks down the complex nuances of IP Law.  We also discuss about the on-going ANI vs Mohak Mangal  lawsuit that has erupted following the copyright strikes by YouTube. We also talk about his role in the Copyright amendment in 2012 and how that amendment changed the entire Indian music industry. We also discuss what contempt of court really means and different angles of it. 

Watch the full episode and listen to a fact based analysis of this entire case by a professional of the field. 

Happy Watching !

Timecodes:
0:00 - Intro
0:50 - What is Intellectual Property?
9:03 - What exactly violates a copyright?
11:39 - The repercussions in violating a copyright. 
15:00 - Is there a place for morality in these violations?
21:58 - Does the state have a role in copyright violation cases?
25:10 - ANI vs Mohak Mangal: What has happened?
29:10 - What is our concept of copyright, exceptions and fair dealing.
44:28 - The Exclusivity of a creation. 
47:50 - Does Monetisation violates fair dealing?
51:13 - Does ANI have the right to demand that amount of money?
56:01 - YouTube's three strike policy and revenue sharing aspect of this case.
1:03:13 - Could deleting the three videos a better option that banning the entire channel?
1:09:54 - Is there a free speech violation in this case?
1:17:55 - The Copyright Amendment Act (2012) and his role in changing the Indian Music Industry.
1:23:20 - What exactly is Contempt of Court?
1:28:28 - Outro
